en.title: Graphics Journalist, Digital Cartographer, Engineer, Noodle Connoisseur
en.author: Daniel Kao
en.description: I spend my days crunching data and visualizing news stories for the web and mobile devices.

content.value: I spend my days crunching data and visualizing news stories for the web and mobile devices, currently as an engineer for The Washington Post. Previously, I was a senior graphics engineer for Commonwealth Magazine and frontend engineer for the New York Times. I completed my graduate studies in Cartography and Geographic Information Systems at the University of Wisconsin and undergraduate studies in Computer Science at the University of California, San Diego.

I'm motivated by the idea that digital mediums can help readers better understand complex challenges facing societies today. In addition, I believe that newsrooms are among the most conducive environments to experimentation, development, and creativity.

More broadly, I’m interested in the interplay of technology, maps, politics, journalism, international relations, democracy, and education. My spare time is spent eating noodles, surfing, reading, and traveling.

zh.title: 資料視覺化前端工程師、數位地理資訊學者、湯麵愛好者
zh.author: Daniel Kao
zh.description: 我專門發想以及製作新聞和資料視覺化。

content.value: 當前，我是 華盛頓郵報 的工程師。曾任在 天下雜誌 當前端工程師，專門發想以及製作新聞的視覺化。更之前在 紐約時報 當前端工程師。我的碩士唸威斯康星大學的地理資訊以及大學唸加州大學聖地牙哥的資訊工程。
帶著資工背景進入媒體業，我的初衷是希望運用數位時代的新興技術呈現各種社會複雜的訴求，讓讀者對於切身相關的議題能夠有更好的了解。對他來說，新聞是一個最適合碰撞實驗和創新火花的環境。
此外，我也對科技、地圖、政治、國際、民主和教育有興趣。我其他的時間喜歡吃麵、衝浪、看書和旅遊。
